Dr. Shilpa Balan #cis5250 #visual-analytics Email: sbalan@calstatela.edu I have a Ph.D. degree in Information Systems and 2 Master's degrees-one in Computer Science, and another in Management Information Systems.

item.title: Ariel Pakes
item.description: Ariel Pakes Research Associate at Harvard University. Ariel Pakes is the Thomas Professor of Economics in the Department of Economics at Harvard University and a research associate in the NBER’s Programs on Productivity, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship, and Industrial Organization.

item.title: Central Limit Theorem
item.description: Central Limit Theorem CLT for short. It is used to test out statistical hypotheses. Related [[Confidence Intervall]]

item.title: ceteris paribus
item.description: Ceteris Paribus The latin name for [[other things equal]]. Comparisons made under ceteris paribus conditions have a causal interpretation. Imagine two students identical in every way, so their families have the same financial resources and their parents are similarly educated.

item.title: RAND
item.description: RAND Experiment to check effects of health insurance subsidies. In short, subsidized public health insurance should not be expected to yield a dramatic health dividend.

item.title: randomized trials
item.description: Randomized Trials When analyzing data form a randomized trial or any other research design, masters almost always begin with a check on whether treatment and control groups indeed look similar.

item.title: SAS LAB 7 - Classification Linear Regression
item.description: SAS LAB 7 - Classification Linear Regression Linear regression equation: $y = 3.9 * height- 143.03$ For $p=0.05$ the result are statistically significant because it is greater than 0.

item.title: SAS Lab 7 - Linear Regression
item.description: SAS Lab 7 - Linear Regression $y = mx + b = 188.5*width-433.29$ $R^2 = 0.7875$ $p-vlaue$ should equal or less than $0.

item.title: SAS LAB 7 - Multiple Linear Regression
item.description: SAS LAB 7 - Multiple Linear Regression $R^2 = 0.86$ This shows relatively high correlation between humidity and air and bulb temp There were 584 observations.

item.title: Sir Ronald Aylmer Fisher
item.description: Sir Ronald Aylmer Fisher Lived in the beginning of the twentieth century. 1929 statistical Methods for Research Workers 1935 * The Design of Experiments* invented the method of maximum likelihood.

item.title: The Oregon Trail
item.description: The Oregon Trail Lottery in Oregon in 2008 where applicants could have a chance to win Health insurance. It was aimed at a special group of people (think low income Americans), and applicants won a chance to apply for the insurance.
